Inspection Report on the audit of office of the Deputy Director, Horticulture, Ludhiana

PART-I- (Introduction)

The audit of office of the Deputy Director, Horticulture, Ludhiana was conducted from 12/06/2023 to 21/06/2023 by the following members of field audit party of office of the Audit, Punjab.

Refer - Table 1

The audit was supervised by the following officers.

Refer - Table 2

The main function of the Horticulture Department is to provide technical know-how for increase in yield as well as production in limited area available for horticulture produce, to create awareness regarding high value horticulture crops among farmers, with main focus on crop diversification. This department acts as the bridge among the farmers and the scientific community so as to enhance income by best management practices. The department is mainly entrusted with the work of extension of horticulture, schemes of GOI regarding horticulture. The department provides subsidy / other available facilities to the marginal as well as landless farmers on priority basis so that they can increase their income by adopting horticulture. The Deputy Director, Horticulture performs all these functions at the district level

GeographicalJurisdiction This office is located in the new Horticulture Complex,Near Verka Milk Plant Ferozpur Road, Ludhiana having telephone No.0161-2550490 The e-mail of the office is Ddh_ludhiana@yahoo.com

Audit Objectives

The following objective of conducting audit was to ascertain:

1.Whether internal control/financial management was adequate & effective

2.The implementation and adherence to the formal criteria arising out of the laws, regulation, and agreement applicable in respect of “Mission for integrated Development of Horticulture.”

3.Planning and implementation of the scheme was comprehensive.

4.Proper and fruitful Utilization of the Grants received.

5.The infrastructure and human resources are adequate.

6.Are withdrawals/deposits correctly accounted for and cash book has been reconciled with treasury/Bank Pass Books and expenditure incurred were supported by vouchers/actual payee receipts.

7.Whether proper record related to administration and establishment were maintained

Scope of Audit

The local Audit and Inspection of the Dy.Director/Horticulture, Ludhiana was conducted by an audit party comprising of Sh.Dinesh Diwakar, AAO and Sh Krishan Kumar, AAO under the supervision of Sh.Jaswant Singh, Sr Audit Officer from 12-06-2023 to 22-06-2023 for the period from 07/2019 to 03/2023.

Entry and Exit Conference:

The audit of the office was commenced after appraisal of the scope and objectives of audit in an entry conference with the Deputy Director on 12.06.2023 The audit was concluded on 22.06-2023 after discussing the audit observations raised during instant audit with the Deputy Director, minor points were settled on the spot after discussion.

Reference Number: OBS-731066

Para 1A: Irregular/inadmissible payment of Subsidy under MIDH scheme.

Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH) is a centrally sponsored scheme for the holistic growth of the horticulture sector.

Clause 2.1 of the General Guidelines for all schemes provides that “Detailed procedure for filing applications for financial assistance under all schemes, including on-line applications, cost of application, inspection of projects, scrutiny norms and procedure for scrutiny of project proposals, communication of various sanctions and approvals and record keeping shall be as prescribed by the Board of Directors/Managing Committee from time to time.”

Clause 2.5 provides “The schemes of NHB and other schemes of MIDH including NHM will be mutually exclusive, and benefit can be claimed only from one scheme for one project.”

The cost norms and pattern of assistant under mission for MIDH during XII during plan for National Horticulture Mission (NHM) and Horticulture Mission for northeast and Himalayan States (HMNEH) sub Schemes under Annexure-V C.6 provides the cost and pattern of assistance in respect of the Cold storage units which is as follows:

Refer - Table 5

Further, NHB also provides under Applicants’ Eligibility/ Eligible Organizations that the subsidy for only one component can be availed in respect of Cold Type-1/Cold Storage Type-2/Cold Storage Type2 with add on technology for CA/Technology induction and modernization. Sr. No. 20 of Important instruction for applicant also provides that " The scheme of NHB and scheme of MIDH,including NHM, will be mutual exclusive and benifit can be claimed only from one scheme for one project.

Further, technical standard of NHB also provides that Cold Storage Type-1/Cold Storage Type-2/Cold Storage Type2 with add on technology for CA/Technology induction and modernization are 3 different projects.

During the scrutiny of the record, audit noticed that, the LDHMS disbursed the subsidy for two projects (SC Type I & CS Type 2) under cold store component to seven firms/individuals as detailed below:-

Refer - Table 6

The disbursement of subsidy on two projects is contrary to the guidelines issued by the MIDH results in irregular/inadmissible disbursement of subsidy of Rs. 39004420/- as detailed below:-

Refer - Table 7

The irregular/inadmissible subsidy is computed on the lowest of two subsidy paid to the firms/individuals.

In response to the audit memo department stated that the subsidy has been disbursed as per recommendations/suggestions of the Cool Chain Committee meeting held on 15-06-2016 and on the directions of the then Director Department of Horticulture SAS Nagar Mohali Punjab vide their letter No.1155-76/Cool Chain (69) dated 12-07-2016 (Copy attached). Reply is not tenable because as the para 4.6 of the MIDH scheme, 2014 the State level Committee will oversee the implementation of programmes of the respective state. Even the General Council at the National leveL only give the overall direction and guidance to Mission, monitor and review its progress and performance without affecting the approved programmes, cost norms and pattern of assistance as approved by Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) as mentioned in Para 4.2. Hence the benefit can be claimed only from one scheme for one project as per clause 2.5 of MIDH guidelines.

Reference Number: OBS-733394

Para 1B: Inadmissible subsidy awarded to beneficiaries against the norm of the MIDH Guidelines.

Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH) is a centrally sponsored scheme for the holistic growth of the horticulture sector.

Clause 2.1 of the General Guidelines for all schemes provides that “Detailed procedure for filing applications for financial assistance under all schemes, including on-line applications, cost of application, inspection of projects, scrutiny norms and procedure for scrutiny of project proposals, communication of various sanctions and approvals and record keeping shall be as prescribed by the Board of Directors/Managing Committee from time to time.”

Clause 2.5 provides “The schemes of NHB and other schemes of MIDH including NHM will be mutually exclusive, and benefit can be claimed only from one scheme for one project.”

Further, NHB also provides under Applicants’ Eligibility/ Eligible Organizations under Units and limits of financial assistance: -

Unit and limits of financial assistance: Family or a legal entity eligible to avail assistance under NHB schemes as the case may be shall be considered as an unit in considering eligibility in making application and in availing subsidy in case of Schemes No.1 and 2. The family includes a husband, wife and dependent minor children.

The benefit received / to be received either as individual member of the family, as a Group or jointly by husband and wife and/ dependent/ minor children of same family, and by any of these individual members of the family acting as a partner of a partnership firm, proprietor, as CEO or MD or director of a company, any form of legal entity etc shall be considered as benefit received by the said family and legal entity.

The FORMAT II-C (Undertaking to be given with subsidy claim form) provides the following.

Under point no. 6 - No subsidy/grant in aid other than shown in application form has been availed/ is to be availed by the promoters/Directors/Partners/proprietors for this new project and component thereof from Central Govt or any of its agencies except the NHB.

Under point no. 7: - Myself or any other promoter of Cooperative Society, Partnership Firm, Self Help Group has not availed any subsidy from NHB which has not been disclosed in the application.

Reference Number: OBS-725097

Para 2: Inadmissible payment of subsidy.

Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH) is a centrally sponsored scheme for the holistic growth of the horticulture sector. Clause 7.47 of the Scheme provide that “Assistance for setting up of new cold storage infrastructure will be available only to multi-chamber cold storage units with technologies which are energy efficient with provision for thermal insulation, humidity control, advanced cooling systems, automation, etc., having specifications and standards approved by the Ministry. While Cold storages (Long term storage and distribution hubs) up to 5000 MT capacity will be promoted under NHM/HMNEH sub-schemes (Annexure V)”.

Further, The cost norms and pattern of assistant under mission for MIDH during XII during plan for National Horticulture Mission (NHM) and Horticulture Mission for north East and Himalayan States (HMNEH) sub Schemes under Annexure-V C.6 provides the cost and pattern of assistance in respect of the Cold storage units which is as follows:

Refer - Table 5

During the test check of the record, the audit noticed that the HDNHMS disbursed the subsidy under the “Cold Storage Units Type 2 with add on technology for Controlled Atmosphere” to the beneficiary as detailed below.

Refer - Table 10

Further scrutiny of the records revels that the The Ludhiana District Horticulture Mission Society,(TLDHMS) gave the subsidy for the part of the item i.e. for add on technology for controlled atmosphere ( for installation of solar panel) instead of the whole item as detailed in the guidelines. Further, the beneficiaries to whom the subsidies paid never availed any subsidy for cold storage under the scheme. As per the guidelines of the MIDH the subsidy is to be paid for the whole component not for part of the component. Subsidy for the add on components may be given to the existing beneficiary those who have availed the subsidy for cold store or to those beneficiaries who go for the whole project as mentioned in the guidelines of MIDH,2014.

Thus, payment of Rs. 874000- as subsidy amount to beneficiaries renders the expenditure as inadmissible. In reply to the audit memo department stated that the matter will be taken up with higher authority. Final compliance is awaited.

Reference Number: OBS-726065

Para 3: Improper/Non maintenance of GPF ledger accounts

As per notification No. 12/229/80-GPF/4688 dated 02.05.1989 issued by the Government of Punjab (Finance Department), Head of the Department/ Office shall maintain the General Provident Fund (GPF) accounts in GPF ledger in the form P.F.-9. The heads of the department/ office should initial the GPF accounts monthly in order to ensure that the subscriptions deducted, refund of advance and withdrawal etc. are posted correctly and regularly in the each GPF ledger account. At the end of financial year, GPF maintaining authority should prepare GPF statements of all subscribers working under him in form PF-5 and forward the same to the subscribers through their DDOs.

During test check of GPF records, it was noticed that GPF Accounts for the year 2022-23 have not been maintained in the G.P.F ledger (class-iv) of the concerned subscribers complete in all respects. Further, it was also noticed that Sh. Gyan Singh, Peon had withdrawn an amount of Rs.5,00,000/- vide voucher No.322 dated 29.09.2022 as non-refundable advance but the same was not deducted in the G.P.Fund ledger of the concerned subscriber.

In the absence of which, the possibility of misappropriation or overpayment cannot be ruled out.

On being pointed out department stated that the GPF ledger account will be maintained shortly and shown at the time of next audit. Final compliance is awaited.

Reference Number: OBS-724411

Para 5: Non deduction of TDS under GST

Section 51 of the CGST Act 2017 provides for deduction of tax by the Government Agencies (Deductor) or any other person to be notified in this regard, from the payment made or credited to the supplier (Deductee) of taxable goods or services or both, where the total value of such supply, under a contract, exceeds two lakh and fifty thousand rupees. The amount deducted as tax under this section shall be paid to the Government by deductor within ten days after the end of the month in which such deduction is made alongwith a return in FORM GSTR-7 giving the details of deductions and deductees. Further, the deductor has to issue a certificate to the deductee mentioning therein the contract value, rate of deduction, amount deducted etc.

The Empowered Monitoring Committee had approved the 'in-principle' of Rs.762.88 lakhs as a assistance for establishing the centre of excellence for flowers at Doraha, Ludhiana under Indo-Dutch work plan on 20.01.2016. The 15thempowered Monitoring Committee(EMC) of the National horticulture Mission meeting held at new Delhi dated 13.07.2018 gave the financial assistance of Rs.808.79 lakhs. In between the progress of the CoE withheldas The National Highway Authority of India started the process of accruing land for the upcoming State Highway of which the Gazette notification was published in 03.12.2020. Director, Department of Horticulture, Mohali, Punjab addressed to all Drawing and Disbursing Officer, Horticulture, Punjab, vide Memo No. 14555-72/Planning/Revolving Fund(2013-14) Chandigarh dated 28/10/2013 for updation of revolving fund and opening of current account Flexible Fixed Deposit for different units i.e. Nursery and vegetable seed Farm under Department of Horticulture. Remaining unutilized amount kept in the Bank in the shape of Fixed/Flexi Deposit so that more interest earned on the unutilized amount and the same amount should be deposited in the receipt head of concerned department.

During test check of records, it was noticed that the department had opened a normal current account rather than Fixed/Flexible current account.The flexi current account actually doesn't gives interest on current deposit but whatever amount isin current account above certain limit(fixed by the department), gets converted into a fixed deposit and hence gives the source of earning from unused lying funds.

The non-compliance of the instructions issued by the Director, Horticulture, Punjab results in loss of interest which would have been earned by the flexible-fixed Deposit current account.

In reply, department stated that the compliance will be done and shown at the time of next audit. Final compliance is awaited.

Para 8: Non creation of Sanctioned post and deployment of staff without any sanctioned post in Ludhiana District horticulture Mission Society (LDHMS)

Mission for integrated development of Horticulture (MIDH) operational guidelines April, 2014 clause 4.14 provides that Sate Missions can also set up State level Technical Support Group (TSG) for project formulation, appraisal and concurrent monitoring. State Missions will have freedom to hire consultants for providing technical Support at State as well as districts levels and for this purpose, funds will be provided from states TSG component.

Further, Clause 8.1 of the MIDH Guidelines states that “ For managing various activities of Mission at state and District Mission offices and implementing agencies for administrative expenses, consultants at state and District level, project preparation, computerization, contingency etc., 5% of total annual expenditure will be provided to state Horticulture Mission/implementing agencies. State implementing agencies will make provision for this in their annual action plan.

During the scrutiny of the information as provided by the Ludhiana District horticulture Mission Society (LDHMS) audit noticed that the district Mission don’t have any sanctioned post for TSG components as well as for managing various activities of District Mission. Further, audit noticed that during the audit period the four employees working in LDHMS from in various post without any sanctioned post. In the absence of sanctioned posts, the pay and allowance of the officials working under LDHMS could not be justified in audit.

Non creation of sanctioned post by the LDHMS not only hampers the proceedings and works of the mission but also impact the achievement and targets of the Mission.

On being pointed out department stated that the matter will be taken up with the Mission Director MIDH. Final compliance is awaited.
